function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Tracer gas concentrations decayed to below detection limits within a short time after window opening","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Influence of meteorological factors on air change rates may impact the spread of contagious diseases in indoor environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased air change rate due to window opening","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in air change rate due to window opening","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Presence of turbulent eddies at the window opening","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate air change rate measurement due to transient effects","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quantified relationship between air change rate and window opening width in real homes.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in air change rate due to window-opening behavior leading to variability in indoor air quality.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effect of wind speed and occupancy on air change rates in homes.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High air change rates due to occupant behavior","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to differentiate between air loss to outdoors and to adjacent apartments","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low air change rates in occupied houses","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased correlation between indoor and outdoor pollutant concentrations","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Open windows may lead to the uneven distribution of pollutants in a building, with some areas experiencing rapid reduction in pollutant concentration while others take longer to clear.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid influx of air when opening a window increases the air change rate","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence of air change rate on window width and elevation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant increase in air change rate with multiple open windows","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited information for policy decisions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unknown effects of anti-contagion policies on infection rates","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of historical precedent for the current pathogen and policies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Costs of anti-contagion policies are visible, while health benefits are unseen","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Business restrictions increase unemployment and school closures affect educational outcomes","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Comparing growth rate of infections before and after policy implementation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compilation of subnational data on daily infection rates and policy deployments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Almost perfect exponential growth of covid-19 infections due to susceptibility of populations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variable rate of exponential growth influenced by policies and epidemiological factors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on statistical approaches may overlook important factors impacting disease propagation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate data on infections due to differences in reporting at subnational levels.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for demographic and socioeconomic factors may bias policy recommendations.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High early infection rates of covid-19 without policies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variability in growth rates due to multiple factors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Irregularities in pre-intervention infections data in wuhan","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exponential growth of covid-19 cases due to uninhibited spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High susceptibility of population to the virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of policies in reducing growth rate of infections","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete deployment of policy actions in different localities","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transient responses to policies in different countries","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of data for estimating temporal dynamics of policy effects in some countries","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent implementation of policies across countries may lead to different outcomes in infection rates.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Statistical noise in individual policy effects may lead to uncertainty in their impact on reducing infection rates.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity of estimates to withholding regional data blocks may introduce uncertainty in the assessment of policy effectiveness.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The deployment of anti-contagion policies significantly slowed the pandemic.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Persistent reductions in growth rates have a compounding effect on infections.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The number of covid-19 infections depends on the growth rate of infections on all previous days.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of cumulative infections in no-policy scenario","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainties in the estimates","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Susceptible-infected-removed model based on estimated case-detection rates","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large-scale anti-contagion policies may have slowed the covid-19 pandemic, suggesting that interventions have reduced the severity of the outbreak.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of available data pose challenges to the analysis.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate estimation of infection growth rates based on anti-contagion policies and the counterfactual scenario","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
